title: Flash CS3 Professional and OpenType
content:
Does Flash CS3 Professional support any advanced OpenType features or extended language support? Does it have a glyph Palette?

James
author: terminaldesign

comments.content:
No, there seem to be no changes at all to Flash 8.

Once again, the Suite doesn't deserve this title, when it comes to text features …

Ralf
Flash CS3 really only has one notable feature: native support for intel Macs. Don’t bother looking for other reasons to upgrade, because there aren’t any.

[The following features are new to Adobe® Flash® CS3 Professional](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090552/http:/livedocs.adobe.com/flash/9.0/UsingFlash/help.html?content=WS7C4F9BCB-CF7A-462b-887A-A7FCD32E6325.html)

Yeah, text features in Flash CS3 are still so 90's. Text engine is such a pain in the ass and I hate the lack of OT support. You can't even manually insert common ligatures from Adobe's own Pro fonts.
